p: No SHUV infection was observed in the Cx. p. pipiens mosquitoes (N = 211) following oral exposure, whereas infection rates of 2% were found for orally exposed Ae. aegypti mosquitoes (N = 149; Fig 2B). SHUV replicated to median titers of 6.3 x 10 3 TCID 50/ml in body samples of Ae. aegypti ( Fig 2F), which was comparable to titers found in biting midges. No SHUV was detected in any of the saliva samples taken from either Cx. p. pipiens or Ae. aegypti ( Fig 2D). Thus, SHUV was able to successfully infect a small proportion of Ae. aegypti mosquitoes but not Cx. p. pipiens, and no evidence was found for transmission of SHUV by mosquitoes.
